channel.title: My makeover mage doesn't work right..Read the rest PLEASE HELP
channel.description:
So hi, My makeover mage does not work.. (for females) When I turn into a female I look like I should..But then when I move or click anything I turn back into a man.
So I added a ::female command And it does the same thing. Anyone help? Thanks

item.title: My makeover mage doesn't work right..Read the rest PLEASE HELP

Hey uhmm duhpk
Have you downloaded it? I need it fixed today . I told me hoster I would be done today :s

item.source: My makeover mage doesn't work right..Read the rest PLEASE HELP

item.title: My makeover mage doesn't work right..Read the rest PLEASE HELP
item.dc:creator: @Word_Life Word Life
item.description:
@Word_Life wrote:

[quote=“DuhPk, post:9, topic:358187”][quote author=Word Life link=topic=454693.msg3329390#msg3329390 date=1283366185]

Lol nope. My name is just “mr”

;D

Also… I know this sounds stupid but how do I see if its there? :s

Check any files dealing with GFX, and find any signs about the Female character. I wouldn’t know, I never had this problem.

PS What base are you using?

Gfx has nothing to do with your in-game character, Gfx is like for example ice barrage’s block around you would be an example of a type of Gfx so if you were to go onto a server with ::gfx and you were to type ::gfx 369 the ice barrage’s cube would form around you just like you were being barraged by someone.
Anyways…
What source are you using? Depending on what source/protocol your using the makeover mage buttons are handled by a file called “Actionbuttons” or “Clicking” and the codes must be properly added into these files for it to change the look of a character.
If you can tell me your protocol and base I can help you.

OR somewhere in the Client class.

&& Damn I fail.
[/quote]

More than likely clicking handling isn’t handled in client.java it’s usually done in it’s own separate file.[/quote]

Nowadays yes. But there maybe a server or 2 out there nowadays that still handle that stuff in client.java.

All I know is Czar based server’s like Allstar did.

Read full topic

;D

Also… I know this sounds stupid but how do I see if its there? :s

Check any files dealing with GFX, and find any signs about the Female character. I wouldn’t know, I never had this problem.

PS What base are you using?

Gfx has nothing to do with your in-game character, Gfx is like for example ice barrage’s block around you would be an example of a type of Gfx so if you were to go onto a server with ::gfx and you were to type ::gfx 369 the ice barrage’s cube would form around you just like you were being barraged by someone.
Anyways…
What source are you using? Depending on what source/protocol your using the makeover mage buttons are handled by a file called “Actionbuttons” or “Clicking” and the codes must be properly added into these files for it to change the look of a character.
If you can tell me your protocol and base I can help you.
[/quote]

OR somewhere in the Client class.

&& Damn I fail.[/quote]

More than likely clicking handling isn’t handled in client.java it’s usually done in it’s own separate file.

[quote=“Mr…x…, post:8, topic:358187”]Its 317
Its was called cammy pvp beta v2
But Im not sure what “base” it is sorry
Hope you can still help[/quote]

Can you provide me with a DL link for that server so I can take a look at it?

Check any files dealing with GFX, and find any signs about the Female character. I wouldn’t know, I never had this problem.

PS What base are you using?[/quote]
Gfx has nothing to do with your in-game character, Gfx is like for example ice barrage’s block around you would be an example of a type of Gfx so if you were to go onto a server with ::gfx and you were to type ::gfx 369 the ice barrage’s cube would form around you just like you were being barraged by someone.
